result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan Michael Hess

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jordan Michael Hess
Current: 1475 Eliza St, Green Bay, WI 54301 United States  (Effective: 10-18-2022)
Prior: 1480 Western Ave # 6, Green Bay, WI 54303

11:02 AM Defendant Jordan Michael Hess in court.  Attorney Mark J Gumz in court for Jordan Michael Hess.  Attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that the matter is heading towards resolution; parties are trying to work out some things yet.

BY THE COURT:  Set plea/sentencing
bond continued
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

4:27 PM Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Jordan Michael Hess.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states an offer was made and believes there could be resolution.  Requests further status.  No objection by Atty Burdon.
BY THE COURT:  Reset.
Status hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Status hearing on October 18, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Atty Burdon files the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Dolch received a copy of the information and waives its reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

10:47 AM Defendant Jordan Michael Hess appeared by video.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for Jordan Michael Hess.  Attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Dolch states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant regarding in-person appearance.  Defendant waives their in-person appearance today & will proceed by zoom. 

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant asks for a breakout room.
10:51am  Breakout room

10:53am  BACK ON THE RECORD:
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Status hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on August 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

3:34 PM Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jordan Michael Hess appeared by video.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Jordan Michael Hess. 
Atty Gumz is projecting a waiver of Preliminary Hearing; requests a waiver of Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Set waiver of Prelim by zoom
bond continued
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Waiver of Prelim on June 14, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:53 AM Defendant Jordan Michael Hess appeared by video.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Jordan Michael Hess.  Attorney Brian Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states that he and the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading. Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands. 
Atty Gumz waives the time limits for the Prelim.  Defendant agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on May 16, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:48 AM Defendant Jordan Michael Hess appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and wants to get an attorney.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
Bond continued  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription  *No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license

03:27 PM Defendant Jordan Michael Hess appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail.  Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  

  Atty Burdon has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription
*No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license  Initial appearance scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
